title: Is Ahri charm supposed to pull you in at current MS?
body:
The tooltip says you will harmlessly walk towards her, but I just played a game as Ryze (still won, not a qq thread) where I had hit her with a Q that discharged 2 runes AND proc'd Stormraiders. During this time she charmed me and I ran into her turret at lightspeed.

Intended or not?

replies.body:
Well your SS mastery causes the reduction of slows at 75%, yep, it's intended.

This even works on Yi during his ult.
but why would you want a yi running at you at light speed???
Not his fault your champion is damn hot {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
id rather pick fiddle and see I'm run away

Seems weird that it's coded as a slow, but I guess it makes sense. 
Thanks for clearing that up!
its not coded as a slow, or she wouldn't be able to charm yi during his ult
There's two parts to it, the Charm and the Slow. Same as a Fear, there's the Fear and the Slow. Yi is Fearable, but isn't slowable, so he runs away at max speed. Same concept.
You move towards her at half speed, aka a 50% slow, which can be negated through slow reduction.

Stormraiders' slow resistance made you run at her rather than walk.

Not a bug.

no

it makes you walk to her at 50% MS It ignores anything that would resist slows because it isn't a slow its a speed reduction

if you popped stormraiders you'd still be going fast even at 50% movespeed

Definitely not intended, probably a bug involving movespeed math.

One other bizarre thing i have seen is that charm prevents rocket grab from moving a target.
Yeah next time you might want to make use of all that MS to _**DODGE**_ it y'kno....
